messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

NOT LGTM

I think os.TempDir is usually known to users as a directory that hosts "temporary files", not "temporary directories" (although that is also true, the former is not wrong).

The patch makes me think there are two notions of default temporary location, one for files and one for directories.

On 2013/06/04 08:55:13, remyoudompheng wrote:
> NOT LGTM
> 
> I think os.TempDir is usually known to users as a directory that hosts
> "temporary files", not "temporary directories" (although that is also true, the
> former is not wrong).
> 
> The patch makes me think there are two notions of default temporary location,
> one for files and one for directories.

OK, I should tread directories as files just like unix.

subject: code review 10001043: io/ioutil: fix a wrong word.
